page.title: 04ECOLOGY - FLORA & FAUNA
page.content: Many varieties of plants were found on the woodland floor, including bracken, beech fern, lichen, thread and feather mosses. The flowers that were found in the river valley included: foxglove, clover, bluebell, harebell, chamomile ,milkmaid, pink campion, bugle, vetch, wild pea, yarrow, coltsfoot,ragwort, dock, thistle, hogweed, daisy, cow parsley and dog rose. The wild animals that were in evidence here were: rabbit, mouse, mole, fox, hedgehog, squirrel, badger and deer,the last of these being found here after an absence of many years. The small insects included spider purple ground beetle,earwig, centipede, snail, fly wasp and woodlouse.
